pullRequest.body:
As the second part of #19582, this PR mostly contains the changes to the `Basic` file.

It mainly:

- redefines `GroupExtension.Equiv` with `MulEquiv` rather than `MonoidHom`;
- adds lemmas that do not require a commutative group, as a preparation for the main PR;
- defines `GroupExtension.Splitting.semidirectProductMulEquiv`, an isomorphism between the group associated to a split extension and a semidirect product; and
- defines `GroupExtension.ConjClasses`, the conjugacy classes of splittings.

It also contains some definitions and lemmas unused in the main PR, such as:
- `GroupExtension.quotientRangeInlEquivRight`, provided as a shorthand for end-users; and
- `GroupExtension.Section.section_inv_mul_mem_range`, provided as a symmetric counterpart of a required lemma.

They may be dropped if this PR would introduce a too large diff.

Moves:
- GroupExtension.Equiv.mk -> GroupExtension.Equiv.ofMonoidHom

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [9358abf192](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20998/commits/9358abf1928902b0c14fe646f4dd2c2f6e2f41a7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.GroupTheory.GroupExtension.Basic` (new file)|836|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ConjClasses`
`+ coe_toMulEquiv`
`+ conjAct`
`+ equivComp`
`+ exists_eq_inl_mul`
`+ exists_eq_mul_inl`
`+ exists_mul_eq_inl_mul_mul`
`+ exists_mul_eq_mul_mul_inl`
`+ instance : EquivLike (S.Equiv S') E E'`
`+ instance : MulEquivClass (S.Equiv S') E E'`
`+ inv_mul_mem_range_inl`
`+ map_inl`
`+ mul_inv_mem_range_inl`
`+ mul_inv_mul_mul_mem_range_inl`
`+ mul_mul_mul_inv_mem_range_inl`
`+ ofMonoidHom`
`+ quotientKerRightHomEquivRight`
`+ quotientRangeInlEquivRight`
`+ rightHom_map`
`+ right_splitting`
`+ semidirectProductMulEquiv`
`+ semidirectProductToGroupExtensionEquiv`
`+ setoid`
`+ surjInvRightHom`
`+ toMulEquiv_eq_coe`
`++ refl`
`++ symm`
`++ trans`
`-+-+ Equiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I would just call this `GroupExtension.section` or `«section»` (if it works), and emphasize that this is an arbitrarily chosen inverse (or section) in the docstring, instead of "the inverse".

The name `«section»` works, but I think that the current name adds more readability in `def GroupExtension.conjActSurjInvRightHom` and its lemmas which will be introduced by the main PR.

As for the docstring, I actually just followed the one for `Function.surjInv`, but I do agree that it should be emphasized that this is an arbitrarily chosen section.

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/3da619bbabf44fff881851c0a844899472cb2381/Mathlib/Logic/Function/Basic.lean#L426-L428

I've revised the docstrings in the commit 9c7e3b1266cb40182bd208411c513bce29e24b70.

```suggestion
theorem mul_inv_mem_range : σ g * (σ' g)⁻¹ ∈ S.inl.range := by
```
Since `Section` is already in the namespace. Same below.
The lemmas are now renamed in the commit 59c947410561a2b6fec4c0650f31b68b7d09a4a9.

I think this could benefit from having `comp` in the name, but it makes the name longer and `compEquiv` might also be confusing. `postcompEquiv` might be better but it is even longer so it's up to you.
Thank you. I've renamed it to `equivComp` in commit a893ca5c77c18f08c263401759e76b5eedb944fc.

It generates `equivComp_toFun` which has the type `(σ.equivComp equiv) g = (⇑equiv ∘ ⇑σ) g`; however, it is more convenient to have the current `equivComp_apply` (renamed from `ofEquiv_def`) which has the type `σ.equivComp equiv g = equiv (σ g)`.

Is there an alternative method to generate the lemma or can I just keep the current hand-written one?
The lemma is now generated by `simps!` (9358abf1928902b0c14fe646f4dd2c2f6e2f41a7).

I think you can just prove bijectivity in one go. And I would suggest you to state the actual statement in the docstring in addition to mentioning that this is an application of the five lemma.

Alternatively, maybe one might want to make `equiv` contain the whole `MulEquiv` so that the inverse has good definitional properties, and provide this as a constructor of that structure.

Thank you for your comment. I decided to redefine `GroupExtension.Equiv` with `MulEquiv` and implement `GroupExtension.Equiv.ofMonoidHom` for constructing one without providing the inverse.

This change along with the addition of some instances and simp lemmas is available in the commit 992a627c742c37d423b15e126e3205c124713f20.

```suggestion
@[to_additive (attr := simps) "An additive group extension is equivalent to itself."]
```
Does this work? You might need to set up some `initialize_simps_projections` business.

Same for the other constructions

Adding `simps` raises this warning:
> The definition GroupExtension.Equiv.refl_toFun is not a constructor application. Please use `@[simps!]` instead.

… and adding `simps!` generates `GroupExtension.Equiv.(refl|symm|trans)_(to|inv)Fun`. Are these lemmas what you are looking for?

```suggestion
  iseqv :=
  { refl := refl S
    symm := symm S
    trans := trans S }
```
I think this is the preferred spelling.
Can you point to `Equiv.ofMonoidHom` (and include the file name) in the docstring?
Thank you. I've revised the docstrings in the commit cc0a63e68913fe93a2f9c981ace2e3ca805b0659.

pullRequest.title: chore(GroupExtension/Basic): add lemmas about extensions by (non-abelian) groups
